comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: adblockermax.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://adblockermax.com/land101/?_token=uuid_s7m785hr89cd_s7m785hr89cd67e9d3184af9e0.96516795&_subid=s7m785hr89cd&_uidpr=67e9d31843e835.60984138&_prid=e24a5db0688609c925c66c687b4ea0f5](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fadblockermax.com%2Fland101%2F%3F_token%3Duuid_s7m785hr89cd_s7m785hr89cd67e9d3184af9e0.96516795%26_subid%3Ds7m785hr89cd%26_uidpr%3D67e9d31843e835.60984138%26_prid%3De24a5db0688609c925c66c687b4ea0f5) ### Comment > 'Adguard Max' Forced Popup Advertisement Issue > > 1. After starting Windows, I launch Chrome. > > 2. A new tab with an 'Adguard Max' advertisement automatically pops up. > > Please resolve this issue. > > If this is being done intentionally by the same company to force popup ads, > then at the very least, show some basic decency by providing a checkbox > to stop these popups for paying users. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/fgpqyaywk4gk88ww0gg84oko4co0k4odalqpnhvq9s.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.0.214 MV3 System version: | Windows 10 Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

AdGuard Tracking Protection

Other:
Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion

List-KR Browsing Security: | disabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled Other extensions used: | Adguard

comment.body:
Finding a forum now discussing the same thing at `https://www•technopat•net/sosyal/konu/chrome-acilinca-gelen-uyari-virues-mueduer.3710121/`, it's very likely caused by another browser extension. I only really have this image to go by at the moment, borrowed from that thread:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f05b1805-bfc4-4637-87da-4084e15be4ae)

comment.body:
I give jordansworld right on this; The fraudulent adblocker's popup also says "Ad**Block** Max", not "Ad**Guard** Max".

There's practically certainly some PUP bloatware on OP's PC.
Hmm... I can still reproduce it in Firefox, but not Chromium. Not sure if it's because of scriptlet injection?
